95e6345f-a435-49e6-96d8-8a75dbde2ddc.text:
5.1 Optimization of the computations of higher-order interactions and
integration in the Frites python package
Information of about mentors
●Etienne Combrisson
Email: e.combrisson@gmail.com
Github: https://github.com/EtienneCmb
●Daniele Marinazzo
Email: daniele.marinazzo@gmail.com
Github: https://github.com/danielemarinazzo
Abstract:
This project aims at optimizing the computations of dynamic HOIs. The goal is to be able to
estimate the O-information on both simulated data and real brain data, possibly with high
spatiotemporal resolution. To this end, we start from an existing implementation which was
made during the BrainHack 2021 and 2022. The two implementations of the HOIs are: a
first version using the standard NumPy library (Harris et al., 2020) that was compared with a
second implementation using a more modern library called Jax for accelerated linear
algebra on both CPU and GPU. Finally, the project will

e2613ae0-8e1b-4719-af27-9cb7a58c244f.text:
https://github.com/EtienneCmb
●Daniele Marinazzo
Email: daniele.marinazzo@gmail.com
Github: https://github.com/danielemarinazzo
Abstract:
This project aims at optimizing the computations of dynamic HOIs. The goal is to be able to
estimate the O-information on both simulated data and real brain data, possibly with high
spatiotemporal resolution. To this end, we start from an existing implementation which was
made during the BrainHack 2021 and 2022. The two implementations of the HOIs are: a
first version using the standard NumPy library (Harris et al., 2020) that was compared with a
second implementation using a more modern library called Jax for accelerated linear
algebra on both CPU and GPU. Finally, the project will integrate the developments into the
open-source toolbox called Frites which currently only supports pairwise interactions.
